physical_examinations.vital_signs: Elevated NT-proBNP: 10,569.0 pg/ml; Troponin T: 72.2 ng/L; significantly elevated GGT values: 1264 U/L; elevated direct bilirubin on 5th day: 2.2 mg%; increased inflammatory markers during respiratory infection; microcytic anaemia.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Dysmorphic features including ocular hypotelorism, gothic palate, retrognathism, low-set ears and hairline, hypertrichosis, broad and flat nasal bridge, wrinkled facial skin, pectus excavatum; Developmental defects including arachnodactyly and clubfoot; Axial hypotonia noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During respiratory infections, progression to left-sided crackles, then development of tachypnoea, severe dyspnoea, wheezing, and extended inspiration phase over time.
